meanings.definition: To write or carve words or symbols onto a surface.
meanings.sent1: She used a sharp tool to inscribe her name on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully inscribed his signature on the painting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to inscribe its initials on the park bench.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was inscribed in the hearts of all who knew her.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins inscribe stories of a forgotten civilization.

meanings.definition: To mark or engrave something onto a surface.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler inscribed a special message on the back of the necklace.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization inscribed their laws on stone tablets.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to inscribe its paw prints on the wet cement.
meanings.sent4: His determination was inscribed in every step he took.
meanings.sent5: The memories of childhood are inscribed in the mind forever.

meanings.definition: To dedicate or address a book or work to someone by writing a note inside.
meanings.sent1: The author inscribed the book with a heartfelt message to his readers.
meanings.sent2: She inscribed her latest novel to her loving family.
meanings.sent3: The comedian jokingly inscribed his comedy special to his pet cat.
meanings.sent4: His legacy was inscribed in the annals of history.
meanings.sent5: The dedication inscribed in the book brought tears to her eyes.
